manipulation

Class BitStream

  • java.lang.Object
    • manipulation.BitStream

  • public class BitStream
extends java.lang.Object

    Class handles reading and writing of bits; adding a layer of abstraction to make the process of reading varied amount of bits easier.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      BitStream(byte[] dataBytes)
      Constructor, create a new BitStream instance.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods

      Adds a bit to the data the stream reads from.

      Adds a byte to the data the stream reads from.
      void addBytes(byte[] bytes)
      Adds a byte array to the data the stream reads from.
      int getBits(int numberOfBits)
      Gets a specified number of bits from the bitStream (1,32), returning the bits in the form of a rightmost shifted integer.
      int getBits(int start, int numberOfBits)
      Gets a specified number of bits from the bitStream with a specified starting position in the stream.
      byte[] getData()
      Gets the entire data array the bitStream contains.
      int getEndPosition()
      Gets the end position of the data.

      Gets the position that the bitStream is currently at in the data.

      Checks if the data has reached the end of the data.

      Resets the bitStream back to the beginning of the data.

      • BitStream

        public BitStream(byte[] dataBytes)

        Constructor, create a new BitStream instance.

        Parameters:

    • Method Detail

      • getBits

        public int getBits(int numberOfBits)
            throws BitStreamException

        Gets a specified number of bits from the bitStream (1,32), returning the bits in the form of a rightmost shifted integer.

        The pointer shifts with the read bits.

        Parameters:
        numberOfBits - value of bits to read from the stream
        Returns:
        integer value containing the read bits
        Throws:
        BitStreamException

      • getBits

        public int getBits(int start,
                   int numberOfBits)
            throws BitStreamException

        Gets a specified number of bits from the bitStream with a specified starting position in the stream.

        Parameters:
        start - pointer index to start the reading from
        numberOfBits - value of bits to read from the stream
        Returns:
        integer value containing the read bits
        Throws:
        BitStreamException

      • resetStream

        public void resetStream()

        Resets the bitStream back to the beginning of the data.

      • resetStream

        public void resetStream(int pos)

        Resets the bitStream to the specified position

        Parameters:
        pos - integer index value to set the stream to

      • isEndOfData

        public boolean isEndOfData()

        Checks if the data has reached the end of the data.

        Returns:
        boolean value indiccating if the data has reached the end of the stream

      • addBit

        public void addBit(byte bit)

        Adds a bit to the data the stream reads from.

        Takes the rightmost bit of a byte as the bit to be added.

        Parameters:
        bit - the bit value (in byte form) to add to the bitStream

      • addByte

        public void addByte(byte byte_)

        Adds a byte to the data the stream reads from.

        Parameters:
        byte_ - the byte to be added to the bitStream

        Adds a byte array to the data the stream reads from.
